title: Ticket #6412: HAD transferer crashes when peer can't connect
description: When HAD wants to synchronize the accountant data between central managers, both condor_replication daemons spawn condor_transferer processes, one of which connects to the other to do the data transfer. The listening transferer assumes its peer successfully connects to it. This causes it to crash if the connection attempt fails (say due to a firewall). It should check if a connection was established and exit with an error if there isn't one.
